definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Dragon boat races were held on a large scale in the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 賽龍舟活動在唐朝規模很大。

sentences.english: I once went to the Dragon Boat Festival folk culture village to see the Dragon Boat race.
sentences.chinese: 我端午節有一次去民族文化村看到了賽龍舟。

sentences.english: Other than the dragon boat race, we eat ZongZi.
sentences.chinese: 除開賽龍舟，咱們還喫角黍。

sentences.english: Dragon boat racing will be headed in the world.
Boat racing has become an international sports event.
sentences.chinese: 賽龍舟已成爲一個國際性運動項目。

definition: both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
koinobori, a Japanese carp-shaped windsock flown to celebrate Children's Day
Yunfu prefecture level city in Guangdong province 廣東省|广东省[Guang3 dong1 sheng3] in south China
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active
Longhai county level city in Zhangzhou 漳州[Zhang1 zhou1], Fujian
